posts.cooked: so i posted about my swerve issue with pathplanner, and i think i’ve narrowed it down to being somewhere in this code, but i have no clue what could be wrong other than maybe methods not returning what they are supposed to. the issue is that when i tell it to move in a straight line on the field, it moves in jerky circles. Code:

posts.name: Krystian Booker
posts.cooked:
Could you post a link to the full source code?

In the meantime, our team also uses the Rev MAXSwerve Modules with path planner, you can review our implementation here: 2852 - DriveSubsystem

posts.name: Martin Nemaric
posts.cooked:
Another shoutout to 2846 Firebears! We used this to get Path Planner with MaxSwerve up and running in no time!

Contribute to firebears-frc/FB2024 development by creating an account on GitHub.

it seems like maybe it could be an issue with me using the drive function? i may just adapt your code and see if that works. also i noticed that in your code there was a TODO about choosing between odometry and pose estimator. personally i have found that odometry tends to drift less for whatever reason

posts.name: Krystian Booker
posts.cooked:
That branch is missing some of our latest code which resolved the todos, we have kept it on the SwerveDrivePoseEstimator, using photonvision to update the positioning.

Overall I don’t see anything that stands out that would be causing issues. Driving is working correctly in teleop?
yeah it works perfectly fine, could it not be the drive method? im gonna try using your methods adapted for my code later
